channel.title: Security guards
channel.description:
A few suggestions for the security guards:
1. They should have melee defense abilities (at least against zombies and headcrabs). It would be weird , if a special trained security force wouldn't be able to defend themself at close range.
2. It would be nice, if the radios you added to their protective vest would be used in one or two situations as a scripted sequence.
3. It would also be nice to see security guards without their helmet and dirty faces in the later course of the game.
4. Gun lockers and gun racks would be nice furniture details for security stations and also a way for the player to come by weapons.
5. I know, that guards will be able to take better weapons like a shotgun or mp5 (like the rebels from HL2). But in my opinion a few guards in the later course of the game should already have a better weapon. It would make sense at least.

  1. Barneys are keeping their helmets. If you see one without, it’s a zombie.

  2. Even later in the game they’ll use their glock as primary weapon but can pick up others while traveling with you. They won’t be couvert by mud,sand or blood because it’s painfull to design new character models by that time.

  3. Bm goal isn’t realism but fun. People don’t forget their helmets but failed to grab a bigger gun or climb ladders.

4)Also barneys are supposed to be cannon fodder of the good guys side : limited firepower and training. They can take out small ennemies but don’t match a H/Agrunt without support.

6)About melee : is it really necessary outside a scripted sequence ?

I agree it doesn’t have to be to real but i think guards should be able to climb some basic ladders like ones against the wall but maybe not ones where you have to jump to or get past a obstacle.

item.title: Security guards
item.dc:creator: 1neviv0
item.description:
I do security at a nuclear power plant…

This to me is enough justification, given the amount of radioactive waste randomly scattered throughout black mesa. xD.

Also, IMO, the entire plot seems to depend on the security guards being the way they are in hl1: i.e., not an entire army, but strong enough that some will survive all the way through.

One thing I think is interesting is that the placement of the guards in hl1 always seemed to lead you in the right direction…I’m thinking that’s a bit weird, since as the player, Gordon seems to have foreknowledge they don’t. Also, I seem to recall there were parts of the levels that were swarming with security guards, despite the fact that A. they weren’t particularly safe, and B. they were far away from anywhere that really needed to be guarded.
Just an example; The sheer number of guards in blast pit, which looked mostly abandoned.

Idk to what extent that can be fixed at this point (probably scripted sequences are going to be impossible to change), but for all I know it may be as easy as dropping a couple here and there to solidify the illusion of guards rushing separately to safety, as opposed to HL1 where they were all the same guard and played the role of constant sidekick.
